repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Adds Show Diagnostics, Show All Diagnostics and Configure Diagnostics buttons to the context menu.

Fixes: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/32115

comment_data.body: `go to defintion` should be in the same "group" as diagnostics and other lsp-like menu items.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -383,10 +383,14 @@ end
 do
   --- Right click popup menu
   vim.cmd([[
+    anoremenu PopUp.Show\ Diagnostics       <Cmd>lua vim.diagnostic.open_float()<CR>
+    anoremenu PopUp.Show\ All\ Diagnostics  <Cmd>lua vim.diagnostic.setqflist()<CR>
+    anoremenu PopUp.Configure\ Diagnostics  <Cmd>help vim.diagnostic.config()<CR>
+    anoremenu PopUp.-1-                     <Nop>
     anoremenu PopUp.Go\ to\ definition      <Cmd>lua vim.lsp.buf.definition()<CR>

@@ -383,10 +383,14 @@ end
 do
   --- Right click popup menu
   vim.cmd([[
+    anoremenu PopUp.Show\ Diagnostics       <Cmd>lua vim.diagnostic.open_float()<CR>
+    anoremenu PopUp.Show\ All\ Diagnostics  <Cmd>lua vim.diagnostic.setqflist()<CR>
+    anoremenu PopUp.Configure\ Diagnostics  <Cmd>help vim.diagnostic.config()<CR>
+    anoremenu PopUp.-1-                     <Nop>
     anoremenu PopUp.Go\ to\ definition      <Cmd>lua vim.lsp.buf.definition()<CR>

comment_data.body: shouldn't lsp actions have a fallback to other methods in case there's no server attached to the buffer ? maybe get a tag definition using `taglist()`
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -383,10 +383,14 @@ end
 do
   --- Right click popup menu
   vim.cmd([[
+    anoremenu PopUp.Show\ Diagnostics       <Cmd>lua vim.diagnostic.open_float()<CR>
+    anoremenu PopUp.Show\ All\ Diagnostics  <Cmd>lua vim.diagnostic.setqflist()<CR>
+    anoremenu PopUp.Configure\ Diagnostics  <Cmd>help vim.diagnostic.config()<CR>
+    anoremenu PopUp.-1-                     <Nop>
     anoremenu PopUp.Go\ to\ definition      <Cmd>lua vim.lsp.buf.definition()<CR>

comment_data.body: The lsp actions only get added if an lsp is attached. If there's no lsp the actions aren't available to prevent any errors.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -383,10 +383,14 @@ end
 do
   --- Right click popup menu
   vim.cmd([[
+    anoremenu PopUp.Show\ Diagnostics       <Cmd>lua vim.diagnostic.open_float()<CR>
+    anoremenu PopUp.Show\ All\ Diagnostics  <Cmd>lua vim.diagnostic.setqflist()<CR>
+    anoremenu PopUp.Configure\ Diagnostics  <Cmd>help vim.diagnostic.config()<CR>
+    anoremenu PopUp.-1-                     <Nop>
     anoremenu PopUp.Go\ to\ definition      <Cmd>lua vim.lsp.buf.definition()<CR>

@@ -422,6 +442,7 @@ do
       local urls = require('vim.ui')._get_urls()
       local url = vim.startswith(urls[1], 'http')
       local ctx = url and 'url' or (vim.lsp.get_clients({ bufnr = 0 })[1] and 'lsp' or nil)
+

comment_data.body: This doesn't fit the `ctx` pattern of this function. But will go ahead and merge to unblock.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -403,13 +406,30 @@ do
     vim.cmd([[
       amenu disable PopUp.Go\ to\ definition
       amenu disable PopUp.Open\ in\ web\ browser
+      amenu disable PopUp.Show\ Diagnostics
+      amenu disable PopUp.Show\ All\ Diagnostics
+      amenu disable PopUp.Configure\ Diagnostics
     ]])
 
     if ctx == 'url' then
       vim.cmd([[amenu enable PopUp.Open\ in\ web\ browser]])
     elseif ctx == 'lsp' then
       vim.cmd([[anoremenu enable PopUp.Go\ to\ definition]])
     end
+
+    local lnum = vim.fn.getcurpos()[2] - 1 ---@type integer
+    local diagnostic = false

comment_data.body: Perhaps instead of `ctx` being just a string, it could be a table instead? That way additional info such as the diagnostic stuff could be passed and checking for it won't be awkward. Should I make that change?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -403,13 +406,30 @@ do
     vim.cmd([[
       amenu disable PopUp.Go\ to\ definition
       amenu disable PopUp.Open\ in\ web\ browser
+      amenu disable PopUp.Show\ Diagnostics
+      amenu disable PopUp.Show\ All\ Diagnostics
+      amenu disable PopUp.Configure\ Diagnostics
     ]])
 
     if ctx == 'url' then
       vim.cmd([[amenu enable PopUp.Open\ in\ web\ browser]])
     elseif ctx == 'lsp' then
       vim.cmd([[anoremenu enable PopUp.Go\ to\ definition]])
     end
+
+    local lnum = vim.fn.getcurpos()[2] - 1 ---@type integer
+    local diagnostic = false

comment_data.body: Not sure. Maybe `ctx` isn't needed anymore. Its original purpose is not clear after some refactors.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -403,13 +406,30 @@ do
     vim.cmd([[
       amenu disable PopUp.Go\ to\ definition
       amenu disable PopUp.Open\ in\ web\ browser
+      amenu disable PopUp.Show\ Diagnostics
+      amenu disable PopUp.Show\ All\ Diagnostics
+      amenu disable PopUp.Configure\ Diagnostics
     ]])
 
     if ctx == 'url' then
       vim.cmd([[amenu enable PopUp.Open\ in\ web\ browser]])
     elseif ctx == 'lsp' then
       vim.cmd([[anoremenu enable PopUp.Go\ to\ definition]])
     end
+
+    local lnum = vim.fn.getcurpos()[2] - 1 ---@type integer
+    local diagnostic = false

comment_data.body: Even I don't see why the checking is done before the function is called. It could just be done in place, removing `ctx` altogether
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -403,13 +406,30 @@ do

       amenu disable PopUp.Go\ to\ definition

comment_data.body: It was needed, but later refactors changed the logic so now all the logic can live in this function.

comment_regular_data.body: I haven't been able to figure out how to disable the separators in PopUp. Calling `amenu disable PopUp.-1-` seems to do nothing.

labels.description: Nvim defaults for options, colorscheme/theme, autocmds/events, etc.

title: feat: add Show Diagnostics to context menu
